intro: Ilex shennongjiaensis, commonly known as Shennongjia holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to the Shennongjia Mountains in China. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and small, red berries that are edible for birds. The plant typically grows at high elevations, thriving in cool, humid climates with well-drained soils. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
